title: UK Faces Snow and Ice Warnings After Wet Spell
summary: Following a period of persistent rain, the UK is bracing for a return to wintry conditions, with snow and ice warnings issued by the Met Office. Arctic air will sweep across the country, causing temperatures to plummet up to six degrees below average. Yellow warnings for snow and ice are in effect for Scotland and northern England from Thursday afternoon to Friday midday. Initially, rain will transition to snow over higher elevations before spreading to lower areas overnight. Accumulations of up to 10cm are expected above 200m. As the precipitation clears southward early Friday, temperatures will drop sharply, leading to icy conditions on untreated surfaces and hazardous driving. Concurrently, the UK's Health Security Agency has issued yellow cold weather health alerts for northern England and the Midlands, warning of minor impacts on healthcare services and risks to vulnerable populations. Temperatures are forecast to normalize by Tuesday. This shift highlights the importance of preparedness for winter hazards.
